reviews.text: Definitely by far the best Thai made beer sold in Thailand, though it probably may not be the best beer in the world (thatâs Carlsberg as we all know). It has some resemblance to great Czech beers but with much milder tones. Itâs sold in Big Câs for a bit more premium than the typical Thai beers but practically never found in any bars, I guess it just got too much taste for average expat Joe. Giving it the highest score here as it really is the only Thai made beer you can place on the premium category.
grapefruit/nectarine turning resiny on nosing. the malt backbone in relation to bitter hop content is nearly perfect. very long clean & dry finish. this is fâing fantastic!!!!

God in heaven save me from this muck. Its not unlike silage mixed with lots of sugar and dragged around New York City in a sack for a week. Iâd rather drink the blood of any farm yard beast than allow this filth past my lips again. Not even Jesus Christ our Savior would touch this stuff.
